ETYMOLOGY: From Old French essai (test, trial, attempt), derived from Late Latin exagium (a weighing, examination), related to exigere (to drive out, demand, measure). Popularized in English by the writings of Michel de Montaigne.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A short, formal or informal piece of writing that explores a specific subject or argument.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 论说文；短文；文章，尤指学生或学者撰写的论述特定主题的短篇作品。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The professor assigned us a 1,500-word essay on the causes of the French Revolution.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 教授给我们布置了一篇关于法国大革命起因的1500字论文。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To attempt or try (to do something); to test or make a trial of.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: They essayed a complex maneuver that required great coordination.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他们尝试了一个需要高度协调的复杂动作。

MEANINGS.SENT_EN: His first essay at painting portraits showed promise, despite its flaws.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他第一次尝试画肖像画显示出潜力，尽管存在缺陷。
